points.info: Mr. Smith: discharge protocol for patient with pulmonary embolism.

points.label: Telephone
points.info: Call (702) 555-5555 to check whether Ms. Jones, discharged yesterday with diabetes, is taking insulin as prescribed.

questions.question: What advantage(s) are there of providing standardized discharge instructions and patient education through the clinical information system? (Check all that apply.)
choices: Customizes the material to the learning style of the patient

questions.question: What disadvantage(s) are there of providing standardized discharge instructions and patient education through the clinical information system? (Check all that apply.)
choices: Materials may not be suitable for a low literacy patient.
Doesn't allow the clinician to modify the materials.
May not be up to date.
Does not link to a coded nursing language.
answers: Materials may not be suitable for a low literacy patient.

questions.question: If a clinician telephones a recently discharged patient about medication compliance, what is this considered?
Which of the following would be an improvement over the telephone to interact with a recently-discharged patient with diabetes? (Check all that apply.)
questions.feedback: Real-time telehealth: could use Skype for a face to face interaction. Remote monitoring: nurse could receive blood glucose meter data.

questions.question: This hospital is part of a regional health information exchange (HIE). In what way could public health agencies use data from its Electronic Health Record system to assess and monitor the health of communities and populations? (Check all that apply.)
choices: To determine the quality and appropriateness of provider orders
questions.feedback: Assess the epidemiology of diseases: it is already being used to assess diabetes epidemiology. Conduct disease surveillance: aggregate data can detect an outbreak.
